title: [Large-Scale] UDL/UID-Based Instructional Design for Inclusive Higher Education in Online Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of online learning environments and basic accessibility principles
context.additional_context: Practicing content design methods applying UDL/UID principles while experiencing diverse disability types via VR simulations. Requires pre-checking accessibility settings for personal devices in BYOD environments.

learning_goals: Learners can apply the three principles of UDL/UID to inclusive strategies for students with disabilities.
Learners can analyze the experiences of students with disabilities in VR-based simulations and propose accessibility improvements.
Learners can apply a UDL checklist to science education content and meet at least 80% of evaluation criteria.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
